thread.title: Lightning win opener, 3-2, in wild overtime
thread.title_full: Lightning win opener, 3-2, in wild overtime

title: Lightning win opener, 3-2, in wild overtime
text:
Lightning win opener, 3-2, in wild overtime The Tampa Bay Lightning won their season opener, 3-2, in a wild overtime period with Philadelphia. Post to Facebook Lightning win opener, 3-2, in wild overtime The Tampa Bay Lightning won their season opener, 3-2, in a wild overtime period with Philadelphia. Check out this story on wtsp.com: http://on.wtsp.com/1Rx1M52 Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Lightning win opener, 3-2, in wild overtime Associated Press, AP 11:23 p.m. EDT October 8, 2015 Philadelphia Flyers center Scott Laughton (21) shoots against Tampa Bay Lightning goalie Ben Bishop (30) during the third period at Amalie Arena. (Photo: Kim Klement-USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
TAMPA, Fla. (AP) - Jason Garrison scored his second goal of the game in overtime, and the Tampa Bay Lightning beat the Philadelphia Flyers 3-2 on Thursday night. 
Garrison's game-winner came on a breakaway at 2:17 of the extra session, which featured end-to-end action in the NHL's first 3-on-3 OT of the regular season. 
The NHL moved overtime from 4-on-4 to the new setup this season. 
Tampa Bay's Ben Bishop faced his second penalty shot at 1:27 into overtime and made a pad save on Scott Laughton. 
It was the first NHL game for Philadelphia coach Dave Hakstol, who spent the past 11 seasons coaching at the University of North Dakota. Seven of his teams at North Dakota reached the NCAA Frozen Four. 
Matt Read and Brayden Schenn scored for the Flyers. R.J. Umberger had two assists. 
The Lightning also got a goal from Ryan Callahan. Read or Share this story: http://on.wtsp.com/1Rx1M52 TOP VIDEOS
